result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. McCracken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $2,197.26.  Joint and Several with the co-defendants Hammes and Smith. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days before discharge.
Obtain and maintain employment and or schooling to equal fulltime.
Complete a psychological assessment and comply with any recommendations, if any.

No contact with Subway in Plover or Amanda Zabawa. 
No contact with co-defendant's Robert Hammes or Nickolas Smith. 
Maintain absolute sobriety for the entire duration of supervision. 
Not possess/consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription by treating physician. 
No intentional contact with anyone associated or actively using illegal drugs.

Comply with any other assessment, treatment or programming which the Dept of Corrections and agent feel are necessary for his rehabilitation. 
Sign release of information for assessments with respect to medication in the event he's placed on medication. 
Provide agent with list of all medications that he may be prescribed. 
All prescription medication must be from one pharmacy. 
Provide DNA sample if not already done so.
Complete AODA and comply with recommendations, if any.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing held on November 17, 2015

letter from the defendant in regards to being eligible for the ERP/CIP program's with attached supporting documentation **letter from Judge Shannon dated 09/23/16 in response to the letter from the defendant, copy of his letter forwarded to defendant's attorney and District Attorney's Officde
from mother of the defendant - Br 2 Judge received and read and indicates on letter that the DOC determines inmates eligibility

Defendant David A. McCracken in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant David A. McCracken in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:00 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court has received the PSI and multiple letters.  Both counsel have received the PSI and those letters. 
Atty Knaapen addresses an additional letter he received from Atty Redfield.  He provides a copy to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Knaapen. 

Parties are prepared to proceed. 
Atty Redfield indicates there were no mistakes in the PSI. 
Atty Knaapen concurs. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - 
Serve 80 months prison with 40 months initial confinement followed by 40 months extended supervision. 
Custody remanded to the Wisconsin State Prison system. 
Eligible for CI and SA Programs. 

Court advises of loss of Firearm/Body Armor privileges.
Court advises of violation of no contact provision. 

Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
No contact with Subway in Plover or Amanda Zabawa.
No contact with co-defendants Robert Hammes or Nickolas Smith. 
Maintain absolute sobriety for the entire duration of supervision. 
Not possess/consume any controlled substances w/o valid prescription by treating physician.
Complete AODA and comply with recommendations, if any. 
Complete a psychological assessment and comply with any recommendations, if any.
Comply with any other assessment, treatment or programming which the Dept of Corrections and agent feel are necessary for his rehabilitation. 
Sign release of information for assessments with respect to medication in the event he's placed on medication. 
Provide agent with list of all medications that he may be prescribed. 
All prescription medications must be from one pharmacy. 
Pay all court ordered financial obligations in full 90 days before discharge. 
No intentional contact with anyone associated or actively using illegal drugs.
Obtain and maintain employment and or schooling to equal fulltime. 
Provide DNA sample if not already done so. 
Pay restitution of $2,197.26.  Joint and Several with the co-defendants Hammes and Smith. 
225 days credit. 

Court provides a copy of the Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant David A. McCracken in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-124, 15CF-123, 15CF-125, 15TR-801, 15TR-802, 15TR-803 and 15TR-804.

2:28 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will enter plea on 15CF-124. Defendant will plead to Count 1. Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 would be dismissed and read in
Parties are anticipating a PSI.  State recommends 10 yr prison. 5 yrs initial, 5 yrs extended supervision, concurrent to current Wood County sentence Defendant is serving. Defense would be free to argue.
State moves to dismiss and read in 15CF-123 and 15CF-125.  
State also moves to dismiss and read in the traffic files as well.

Atty Redfield concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
GUILTY 15CF-124 Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Redfield for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Defendant acknowledges previous convictions.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-124: Count 1: 943.10(1m)a  939.05  939.62(1)(c)
15CF-124: Count 2 and Count 3 and Count 4 and Count 5: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-123: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-125: Dismissed and Read In
15TR-801: Dismissed and Read In
15TR-802: Dismissed and Read In
15TR-803: Dismissed and Read In
15TR-804: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Any bond is revoked, if there is one.
Court orders a PSI.
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David A. McCracken in court with attorney Jared Redfield and Atty Ann Renc. Defendant David A. McCracken in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-123, 15CF-124, 15CF-125, 15TR-801, 15TR-802, 15TR-803 and 15TR-804.

9:40 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Atty Renc has filed a motion to withdraw.
Defendant has retained Atty Redfield.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court regarding substitution of counsel.

BY THE COURT:
Court will grant the motion to withdraw.

Matter will be rescheduled.

  Plea hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant David A. McCracken in court with attorney Ryan Drengler for Atty Anne Renc. Defendant David A. McCracken in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF123, 15CF124, 15CF125

Atty Knaapen requests to adjourn to allow for Atty Renc to be present.  Defendant has not waived the time limits. 
Attorney Drengler waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

  Arraignment scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for David A. McCracken
Current: 2820 100th Street S., Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494   (Effective: 04-16-2015)
Prior: 2820 100th Street S., Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54454

Defendant David A. McCracken in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF123, 15CF124, 15CF125

3:05 p.m.  Court calls the cases.  
There is a waiver of preliminary hearing in 15CF124.  They are asking that the prelim in 15CF123 and 15CF125 be set for a different day. 

15CF124: 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

15CF123 and 15CF125:  Attorney Renc waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.  Arraignment scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
$1,000 cash bond for each file 15CF123 and 15CF124.

2:09 pm. Attorney Anne Renc in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via Video.
Cases 15CF123, 15CF124, and 15CF125 are being heard as initial appearances.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties. 
Bond was previously set in 15CF125 $5,000 cash bond.

BTC: $1,000 cash bond for each file 15CF123 and 15CF124.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
